directive: I feel like we are on the good track, but the landing page and docs are not clearly showing what we are doing. So the strongest parts of our tool (Locus) is that it unifies the interactions with multiple AI clients and they have the unified interface (1), it github native so you can use AI combined with github as database to make stuff more interesting (2), also the built in tools that we created so far is really helpful in addition to using Claude/Codex as raw cli tool (3), also the automation can be done since Locus runs on auto-approval mode

issues.title: Define canonical Locus messaging framework for landing and docs
issues.body:
## Overview

Create a single source of truth for how Locus is described across the landing page and documentation.

## Problem

Current messaging is not explicit enough about the product's strongest differentiators. Teams are describing Locus in different ways, which weakens clarity and conversion.

## Scope

- Define the primary value proposition sentence for Locus.
- Define four canonical pillars and one-line explanations for each:
  - Unified interface across multiple AI clients.
  - GitHub-native workflows where GitHub acts as operational memory/database.
  - Built-in tools that extend beyond raw Claude/Codex CLI usage.
  - Automation via auto-approval mode.
- Write a claim-to-evidence matrix mapping each pillar to concrete product behaviors, commands, and examples.
- Define approved terminology and phrases to avoid (copy style guardrails).
- Add a short "positioning brief" doc in the repo that landing/docs authors can reuse.

## Deliverables

- New messaging brief document in docs/content directory.
- Reusable section snippets for landing hero, feature cards, and docs overview.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] A single messaging brief exists in-repo and is referenced by both landing and docs tasks.
- [ ] All four pillars are documented with clear claims and concrete evidence.
- [ ] The brief includes a terminology table (preferred terms and disallowed ambiguous terms).
- [ ] The brief is concise enough to be consumed in under 10 minutes by a contributor.
- [ ] Product owner review confirms that the brief reflects intended positioning.

issues.title: Rewrite landing page narrative around the 4 core strengths
issues.body:
## Overview

Refactor the landing page copy and section structure so visitors immediately understand what Locus does and why it is different.

## Scope

- Update hero headline/subheadline to communicate the core value proposition from Issue #1.
- Replace or rework feature sections to highlight the four strengths with concrete outcomes.
- Add one "how it works" sequence showing: choose AI client -> run through unified interface -> persist/work with GitHub-native data -> automate with auto-approval.
- Add strong CTA paths to the relevant docs pages.
- Ensure mobile and desktop layouts keep the narrative order intact.

## Content Requirements

- Include at least one explicit mention that users can work with multiple AI clients through one interface.
- Include at least one explicit GitHub-native workflow example.
- Include at least one explicit built-in tools example.
- Include at least one explicit automation/auto-approval example.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Landing page hero and primary sections are updated and deployed in code.
- [ ] The four strengths are visible above the fold or within first major scroll section.
- [ ] All claims on landing are linked or traceable to docs pages.
- [ ] Responsive behavior is verified on common mobile and desktop breakpoints.
- [ ] Copy is consistent with the messaging brief from Issue #1.

issues.title: Restructure docs home and quickstart for product clarity
issues.body:
## Overview

Reorganize documentation entry points so new users can understand Locus quickly and reach value in one guided path.

## Scope

- Redesign docs homepage information architecture with clear "Start here" flow.
- Add/update a quickstart that demonstrates the unified interface, GitHub-native context, built-in tools, and auto-approval in one journey.
- Add "Who this is for" and "What Locus is not" sections to set expectations.
- Improve navigation labels and ordering to match the messaging brief.

## Required Output

- Updated docs index/home page.
- Updated quickstart page with copy-pasteable commands.
- Cross-links from quickstart to deep-dive pages created in later issues.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] A first-time user can reach a working flow by following only docs home + quickstart.
- [ ] Quickstart includes a complete end-to-end example with expected outcomes.
- [ ] Docs navigation exposes the four core strengths as first-class concepts.
- [ ] Terminology and tone match the messaging brief from Issue #1.
- [ ] Broken links check passes for updated docs pages.

issues.title: Add GitHub-native workflows guide with practical scenarios
issues.body:
## Overview

Create a dedicated docs guide that explains how Locus uses GitHub as a native operational layer and why that matters.

## Scope

- Add a "GitHub-native workflows" guide page.
- Document at least three practical scenarios (for example: issue-driven execution, repo-backed planning artifacts, and collaborative review loops).
- Include prerequisites, setup, commands, and expected outputs for each scenario.
- Include limitations and troubleshooting notes for GitHub integration.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Guide contains at least three end-to-end scenarios with runnable command sequences.
- [ ] Each scenario clearly shows what data/state is stored or synchronized through GitHub.
- [ ] The page is linked from docs home, quickstart, and landing CTA sections.
- [ ] Troubleshooting section covers common failure modes and recovery steps.
- [ ] All commands/examples are validated against current CLI behavior.

issues.title: Document unified multi-client interface and provider switching
issues.body:
## Overview

Create a dedicated docs page that makes the "one interface, multiple AI clients" capability explicit and easy to adopt.

## Scope

- Add a "Unified interface" deep-dive page.
- Show how the same workflow/command surface works across supported AI clients.
- Provide a capability matrix for provider-specific constraints (if any).
- Include migration examples for users moving from raw Claude/Codex CLI usage to Locus.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Page includes side-by-side examples showing equivalent workflows across at least two AI clients.
- [ ] Provider matrix is accurate and clearly dated/versioned.
- [ ] Migration guidance includes before/after command patterns.
- [ ] Page is linked from landing and quickstart.
- [ ] Claims in this page match the canonical wording from Issue #1.

issues.title: Expand built-in tools and auto-approval automation documentation
issues.body:
## Overview

Produce a clear, operator-focused docs section for built-in tools and automation in auto-approval mode.

## Scope

- Add or rewrite "Built-in tools" documentation with categorized tool inventory.
- Provide practical examples where built-in tools improve on raw CLI-only operation.
- Add a dedicated "Auto-approval mode" page covering behavior, safeguards, and recommended operating boundaries.
- Include a risk/safety checklist and rollback instructions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Built-in tools page lists currently available tools with purpose and example usage.
- [ ] Auto-approval page clearly states prerequisites, safety controls, and failure handling.
- [ ] At least two real automation scenarios are documented end-to-end.
- [ ] Docs include guidance for when to use manual approval instead.
- [ ] Pages are linked from quickstart, landing, and related concept pages.

issues.title: Run landing/docs consistency audit and publish release-ready checklist
issues.body:
## Overview

Perform a final pass ensuring all updated landing/docs content is consistent, evidence-backed, and ready for release.

## Scope

- Audit all new/updated pages for terminology consistency and claim accuracy.
- Verify every major landing claim maps to at least one concrete docs section.
- Run link validation and basic docs quality checks.
- Produce a concise release checklist for future content iterations.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Consistency audit report is added to the repo with findings and fixes.
- [ ] No contradictory wording remains across landing and docs for the four pillars.
- [ ] Link and navigation checks pass for all touched pages.
- [ ] A reusable checklist exists for future messaging/content updates.
- [ ] Final sign-off confirms content is aligned with directive priorities.
